snippet: The negotiations set to begin on Friday will address changing the electoral system, but some students expressed disappointment at the narrow range of the planned talks.
abstract: Hong Kong government and student groups responsible for huge protests agree to hold negotiations on the future of democracy; some students immediately express disappointment with scope of talks, which will address how to change electoral system within framework of mini-constitution that governs Hong Kong.

byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and ALAN WONG
byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing, and Edward Wong and Hilda Wang from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The negotiations set to begin on Friday will address changing the electoral system, but some students expressed disappointment at the narrow range of the planned talks.

headline.main: Hong Kong Officials and Protesters Agree to Talk
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Officials and Protesters Agree to Talk
